name: Quick and Easy Black Bean Soup
author: Chef John
summary: All you need is a couple cans of beans, an onion, some bacon, and spices to whip up this simple but delicious soup.
ingredients: 2 (14.5 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
2 teaspoons sambal paste (or minced red chiles)
directions: Place bacon in a cold pot
Turn heat to medium, cook and stir until the bacon is cooked but not crisp
Stir in onion; cook and stir for 5 minutes, until the onion turns translucent and golden
Stir in garlic; cook for 2-3 minutes
Add chicken stock, turn heat to medium-high
Stir in oregano, cayenne and salt
Simmer on medium-low, stirring occasionally, for 20-30 minutes
While it's cooking, mash about half the beans to thicken the soup
Stir in black pepper and cumin
Make the relish by stirring together minced green onion, sambal paste, and lime juice
Serve garnished with relish, chopped green onions, and sour cream
